oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE REFRACTION ACROSS A CURRENT WITH STRONG HORIZONTAL SHEARING
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Simons, Richard R.
Maciver, Ruari D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: horizontal shearing
refraction
current
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Experiments have been performed with regular deep-water waves propagating obliquely across a relatively narrow jet-type current. Measurements have been made of wave refraction using an 8-element wave array and 3d acoustic Doppler flowmeters. Results show that wave height and celerity follow the trends predicted by gradually-varied flow theory, but with wave height modulated by weak reflections as the waves pass across the jet. Direction of wave propagation I sfound to be sensitive to the presence of internal reflections from the shear layers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
